alert.note: Alert for Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 12:10PM AKDT until July 26 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM AKDT TUESDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Coastal Flood Advisory, which is in effect from 4 PM this afternoon to 7 PM AKDT Tuesday. The High Surf Advisory has been cancelled. * LOCATION...Kotlik to Hooper Bay. * COASTAL FLOODING...Sea levels will rise 3 to 5 feet above the normal high tides. Strong southwest winds of 30 to 40 mph with gusts to 55 mph will push surge and waves up the beach and any waves generated by the wind on the Yukon River will run up past the forecasted water line. * TIMING...Late this afternoon through Tuesday evening. The highest water levels are expected between 4 AM and 8 AM AKDT Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Objects left on the beach could be washed away. Minor beach erosion will occur.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore.
